item.title: DAGs Are Cool
item.description: [REUPLOAD FROM LINKEDIN] I found an interesting topic from my discrete math class while exploring ways to design tools for data engineers. When designing data pipelines, it is common to visualize them as DAGs or directed acyclic graphs. To break it down, a graph is essentially a collection of points or nodes that are connected by edges. When those edges have a specific direction, the graph is said to be directed.

item.title: Save Your Old Laptop
item.description: Do you have an old laptop lying around that needs just one more Windows update to end it all? Well, like so many others, I implore you to check out Linux. It’s the perfect operating system to bring any PC back to life. There are a wide variety of distros available to choose from based on how much setup you want to do and how “light” you need it to be.
